It turned out to be a very good choice. Although it came in a non original box, it looks and operates like new, and I couldn't find a single flaw in the finish. An added benefit is, it's unlocked from a specific carrier, so there's very little bloatware installed, and the user isn't locked into a contract, which makes the monthly statement about half of one of the carrier sponsored devices. I hope future refurbished purchases are as good.

title: Terrible Bluetooth
text: I worked at Verizon Wireless when the first Androids came out. I've owned over 20 Android phones from different manufacturers since 2008. The S20 is by far the worst when it comes to Bluetooth strength. I keep my phone in my pocket. Every time I sit down or bend over to pick something up my Bluetooth starts stuttering. The only way to get it to stop is to turn off Bluetooth and reconnect. This seems to be an ongoing issue with Samsung Galaxy phones. I've tried every trick there is: resetting Bluetooth cache, turning off battery optimization, buying Samsung Galaxy Pro earbuds. Nothing has worked. This is the last Samsung product I will buy.

title: Nice phone, but slippery and expensive to replace the front glass
text:
We just upgraded from our old S7's to these S20's. Love the additional power of the phone, the battery life is easily double the old S7 (even with more frequent use during the day than what we typical did on our S7's). Screen resolution is super, camera is great.

The things we didn't like are:
- the phone is slippery, especially with the curved front glass on the long edges of the phone
- the slim/lightweight style phone cases that protected the S7 won't protect the front glass on the S20, so you either have to never drop your phone, or you have to get a heavy, bulky phone case, which kinda defeats the purpose of having a thin, lightweight phone
- depending on how you're holding the phone, the curved edge can allow the phone to think that your holding fingers are actually trying to touch the screen and get interpreted as finger presses, which can lead to unexpected things happening on the screen or no action at all when you try to press a screen button or scroll with your other hand (because nothing happens since the phone thinks your holding finger is doing something). So you have to hold the phone the 'right way' to make sure the screen works. Unlike Steve Jobs, I don't think you should have to hold your phone a 'certain' way in order for it to work correctly.
- The curved edges make the front glass easy to shatter if you drop it front-glass down (see attached pic). Even with this little damage to the screen, the screen is half white, which makes the phone completely non-functional.
- It costs *more* to replace the screen than to buy a new phone (as of 10/26/22, screen replacement is $270, and the new phone with tax is $230).
- The phone doesn't support a micro-sd card.
- The phone doesn't have the nifty blinking blue/red/green LED on the S7 that let you know if you had a missed call, notification, or low battery. I miss that feature.

So, while it is a great phone and screen, the practical issues involved in everyday use fall short. We can't recommend this phone.

We are now looking at the S20 FE, which has a flat screen like the S7, a plastic backside (unlike the S20's glass backside), which we think will be a much better choice for our needs.

Note that the S20 FE as a new phone cost less than the S20, but the refurb'd FE's cost more than the refurb'd S20's. I think this is the marketplace voting that the FE is a better practical phone than the S20 flagship. And the FE front screen replacement only costs $150, which is a deal since you are much less likely to break the glass on the FE.

Check the IMEI immediately if you buy refurbished through Amazon because you too can be stuck with Samsung telling you surprise, that's an interesting thing happening with a phone not matching the IMEI.... you know what I mean.

Thanks, I really wanted to have to buy a new phone right now and prove to Samsung support that I did not willingly and knowingly purchase a hot phone.

title: Be Careful with the Renew / Refurbished offering
text:
I would NEVER EVER buy a renew product from RE CELL again. Here’s why. When you buy the “RENEW product”, you have no idea what was the original issue that necessitated the phone return. No way to effectively test to verify that it had been properly repaired. What is the true age of the phone, or the original activation date, which determines your factory warranty. You may not realize the tight return window the seller allows. As in my case miss and it, and you are doomed. RE CELL was most insensitive and inflexible and they took 5 days to respond with an absolute denial of any help, offer an apology much less help me offset the cost of a replacement. I told them of my personal misfortune, acknowledged my negligence in not realizing the return window, and my inability to prove the functionality of the phone because of me current condition.

May 2021 - I paid a total of $513.00 for the “renew” Samsung S-20. I enabled Wi-Fi calling as most carriers suggest. Because of a severe illness I only leave home once per month for chemotherapy. That’s when I discovered that the phone only made calls via the Wi-Fi NOT using the cellular network as it should. After days troubleshooting with my carrier, replacing the SIM card the phone did not work. The local Samsung vendor ultimately diagnosed the issue as a defect with main board. I am in the process of appealing to Samsung to see if I can get any relief. No thanks to RE CELL who could have demonstrated good customer service, by offering me some a reduction on a replacement or the least point me in the direction of alternatives. I am DISAPOINTED with this seller. Hope I can write something more positive about my experience with Samsung's treatment.

UPDATE::;;Samsung did right by me. They repaired the phone, even took care of cosmetic defects at NO COST to me. Way to go Samsung.

The first phone from Amazon, reconditioned, had as bad a battery life as the phone I was replacing.
But they sent me this replacement which works better.
Unfortunately I had to insist to get them to send the replacement first, before I return the defective product.
I did not want to be without a phone for a week or more, and have to do two transfers.
Keep your old phone as a backup until you evaluate the reconditioned phone.

title: Great price on a pretty good phone
text: Phone looks new. Hard to tell it's a refurb.

title: They will send you whatever they want to
text: I ordered a white phone because i was sick and tired of misplacing my black one.  Guess what? They sent me a dark gray and black phone without notification.  To rub salt and lemon juice in the wound, there are verizon apps i can't deleteand when i asked if i could drive to their storeand exchange it for the color i ordered they said no.

title: Don't hesitate to give it a try
text:
Received this phone within 2 days of ordering it via FedEx 2-day delivery, despite Amazon stating it would not be delivered for another 3 days. Very prompt, fast shipping!!! (It did require a signature and since I wasn't home, I had to pick it up at the local fedex shipment center-no biggie).

Today is the first day of using it and I have not had any issues whatsoever. I had some concerns per other reviews that it might not be unlocked but it is and worked right away! It came with a generic charger block, USB cable and the pin to access the SIM and external storage. I would recommend this item even if hesitant as Amazon has a 90 day renewed guarantee so you can return if not satisfied.

I additionally purchased the Asurion 2yr mobile accident protection plan just in case, which totals the cost of this phone brand new with only 1yr manufacturers warranty. Yes, the phone is still expensive but at least I will have an extra year of coverage.

I will update this review in the future if any issues come up.

title: Happy So Far!
text:
It's like having a brand new phone. I've always been hesitant to get a refurbished/pre-owned phone. My husband has received some when utilizing the insurance and they often are well used and buggy. This phone is none of those things. My (88 year old) mom's A01 ran out of storage with app & systems updates with very few apps. We got the Pixel 7, but because I'm so use to the Samsung Galaxy phones, I felt I was constantly fighting the stupid thing. We returned it & I bought this. What a joy it is, so far. Mom is happy & I am happy. If it continues to work well, I will go this way everytime we're ready to upgrade our phones.
I certainly recommend this seller and phone

title: Samsung S20 is Beautiful with Long Battery Life
text:
PROS: It's a Samsung, Everything works great with Verizon Wireless. The screen is amazing, vibrant and sharp. Camera is fantastic. Always happy with Samsung Products.

CONS: The sound is a bit lower than my old S7. Still giving it 5 stars.

title: Not "like new"
text: The phone works excellent but cosmetically it was slightly more "refurbished" looking than expected. Nonetheless a great phone.

title: Great price, great phone
text: I have never bought a cellphone refurbished before but so far I am very happy with it. The only defect I have seen is a few very tiny scratches on the screen but honestly it's nothing even noticeable unless you are inspecting it really closely. Everything is working perfectly thus far. Price was extremely great! I don't use face recognition, only fingerprint but that works great. Battery life thus far seems very good. Please note I have only had it about a week so far. Will update if my opinion changes.

title: Not an "s20 5g"
text: The listing is for a "S20 5g" but the phone that I received was an "S20 5G UW".  They are not the same phone. The UW is a lesser phone that has lesser features, for example the UW doesnt have expandable memory/SD card.  This is a classic bait and switch.

title: Wortless
text: This wS the worse device I ever t r ied to I wn.

title: A WHOLE MACHINE...
text: I HAVE ALWAYS PREFERRED SAMSUNG PRODUCTS, EXCELLENT DEVICE...

title: Know what to expect....
text: Ok so I bought the (Refurbished) Samsung Galaxy S20 5G, 128GB, Cosmic Gray - Fully Unlocked  from Avant Solutions. it came fast and was exactly as described. If you are swapping from an older Samsung phone then I highly recommend using the app "smart switch"  using the google app did not roll over all my contacts/picture/etc.....  This took my old sim and SD card like a chap.  However...  Samsung currently has a mobile data issue with this and alot of folks are commenting on intermittent data issues... soo until a fix comes out you may/might/could run into some issues...  this is not the sellers issue.. soo 5 stars for the seller but only 4 stars for the product..

title: Perfect
text: I was afraid with some of the reviews if I was gonna get the wrong phone or a different phone. But I got the exact phone I ordered and so far and it works amazing. There doesn't seem to be any scratches. Amd the phone only gets hot when it's doing updates. Which I've found as normal for the galaxies I've had. And popping in my 4g Sim card worked perfectly fine. It had to restart twice.

title: No quality assurance
text:
I was so excited to replace my sons old phone, only to notice the sim slot is missing the ejector. So his sim will not be protected if inserted.

The disappointment we both feel right now.

title: Glad to be back!
text: Phone works great and came in great condition. I was so thrilled to get rid of my iPhone and get back into the galaxy world very happy with the phone and seller. Was also fully unlocked as described.

title: Great phone
text: My previous phone was an LG that only had 2 GB of ram. this phone has 128 GB & it is 5g. Phone was in excellent condition to have had a previous owner.

title: Great refurbished phone.
text:
I always buy refurbished phones because I work rough jobs and it doesn't matter what I get, or what case I put on it the phone is gonna be smashed within a year.

This one is already busted, nice big black blotch on the top right corner of the screen. I stepped on it after it fell off of my belt clip getting out of the truck 4 months ago and it still works great.

Price was right given that all cell phones are insanely overpriced anymore, and the description as to the condition of the phone was spot on. It was truly in better condition than described if I am honest.

Battery life was and still is good for the age. No connectivity issues, no issues with the USB C port, speaker wasn't blown out, etc... Everything was like new.

Can't recommend this seller enough.

title: Great phone in great condition!
text: This is a great phone! Didn't take me long to set up at all. I had to get a new one from my older phone freezing from around three hours and the battery life dying in about two hours on other days. So it was indeed time to get a new phone and this one has fast charging and wireless charging. Plus the 128 gb does help a ton as well since my older one had only 64 I think. Also it's pink!! That's another plus. I wasn't about to spend $1000 or so on a new phone, this is at a good price as well! Thank you!

title: DOES NOT WORK WITH VERIZON
text: This phone is NOT unlocked. I brought it to the Verizon store and they were unable to run their network on it. Now have to ask my gift buyer to return it.

title: Wack
text:
Things I love: Works perfectly fine SO FAR, the color, the resolution, camera...

Things I hate: No headphone jack!! Also does not come with the type c headphones. Cheap off brand charger. There is a minor scratch on screen. Battery life not great...

UPDATE: battery really became trash quick and phone is acting very weird, my data provider is great but this phone doesn't let my messages go through a lot of the time.

title: Perfect condition -  looks new.
text:
The phone was packaged very well to minimize any possible damage that might occur during shipping. The phone was in a generic white phone box I guess and was in bubble wrap. It had the plastic film on the display and around the edges. Since I got a Verizon version of the phone, it did not have a micro sd slot - just a slot that only accepted a nano sim card. And a SIM card was not included, but I got one from Verizon for free. What was included was a 15 watt Samsung charger and USB-C cable, and also a SIM card removal tool.

It took about an hour 15 mins - give or take - to fully charge the phone. Everything seems to work well from installing apps to updating software. Very happy with the purchase so far.

Note: In case anyone is wondering, Verizon installed the nano SIM card for me and did not charge an activation fee probably because I already have an existing phone line and I was just changing a device on that line.

title: Great Buy
text: Was a little skeptical at first with the reviews and such but mine is pretty great. I was in dire need of an upgrade from my old device and this one did just that.

title: Customer Service
text: Product arrived missing the sim tray tool, upon contacting the seller they replied very quickly and credited my account 3$ to purchase the tool.  I always give the opportunity to make things right and they did.  The phone is as expected of an s20, cleaned to look new, so far works properly.

They shipped a replacement which tookn6 days to arrive and again it was a Sprint phone NOT unlocked. Now we cannot get refund until both phones are returned and we were not allowed another replacement. Terrible inconvenience.  Not happy.

title: "Conflict in ownership"
text:
Tried to have the phone activated. Sprint reported that the phone had an error of "conflict in ownership". That it was likely stolen; and to get my money back if possible.

Had to send it back to seller (which did not pay for return postage which is awesome).

They received it over a week ago; still awaiting my return funds.

Steer clear

title: Quality refurb product
text:
Verizon Galaxy S20 5G UW SM-G981V
Shipped reasonably quickly, required signature for USPS delivery.
A+ physical condition. While you CAN tell it's been used, it is not scuffed or damaged in any way. Screen is absolutely perfect. Battery is about as expected. Drains faster than I'd like because Samsung, but gets through a day of usage easily. Face recognition and other battery drainers all on, I can spend several hours playing with it for fun and still get through the day.

Very much awesome for a refurb phone, props to the seller for accurate description and prompt shipping. Will buy again.

title: Exactly what I wanted!
text:
My seller was DealGenius4you, and I'm very happy with my purchase!
I bought a Google Pixel 4a 1 year and 2 months ago. Now, I have to charge it twice a day. I previously had a Samsung S8 and wanted to go back to Samsung so I ordered a Renewed S20.
This is my 3rd full day using the phone. After charging overnight, the battery lasts all day even if I play on it often throughout the day. It's noon right now and it's at 73%.
The camera, of course, is great but I'm disappointed that there's no macro shot mode. I do, however, I love that it comes with 128GB of storage.
The phone is also in excellent condition! One minor scratch on the screen that you can't see with a screen protector on. I got a clear case with pink edges and it goes well with the beautiful white back.
As titled, this is exactly what I wanted!

title: Pleased with the purchase
text: I felt it was risky to buy a pre-owned phone, but this is in excellent condition. All I needed to do was have Verizon put a SIM card in it, head back home, and start the data transfer of the content. Paired devices came over too, but they just needed to be unpaired and paired again to work. The return of the old phone was easy enough, as the UPS store only needed the box and to scan a QR code in an email to handle that. My only complaint is with Android itself forcing the screen lock settings it does that, despite a lock swipe and a fingerprint enabled, allows it to be opened with just a swipe at home (as they assume everyone in your home is trustworthy with the most security-dangerous device you have.) In the end, I got a great new phone at a great price.

I went home and email the seller. He said to take it back and have them put a brand new SIM card it. I took it to a different location. I happened to get the "phone whisperer" and he worked on it for almost 1 hour. He did everything he could possibly think of. Finally tried to reset it to factory setting and and right there on the phone front and center was AT&T. I had to return it to the seller 3 days ago and waiting for my refund and shipping charges. I bought my last phone from Amazon and had 0 problems with it, it's been a great phone.

title: Great phone for the price
text: The Samsung Galaxy S20 5G is a powerful and impressive smartphone that has all the features you need to stay connected and productive. Its large screen is perfect for gaming, watching videos, or browsing the web, and with its fast 5G network speeds, you'll be able to do all of this quickly and easily. The S20 5G also has a great camera that takes clear and vibrant photos, making it the perfect phone for capturing memories. Plus, its long-lasting battery means you can stay connected even when there's no outlet to be found. Overall, the Samsung Galaxy S20 5G is a great smartphone that will meet all your needs.

title: Like New - Why buy new?
text:
I will do this review in two parts. 1. As received and programmed and 2 longer term use.

Part 1. First, everything about the phone was like new. No scratches or defects. Transferred old Samsung phone over to the new phone with only minor updates and sign-ins. As for the phone, my only preference would be for it to be slightly larger (I have fairly broad finger tips and the extra width helps.) It could also be a little thicker and have a larger battery capacity. Thin is fine, but usability is more important - lifecycle before charging needed. The phone got a little warm during setup when the processor was running continually, but is OK under normal use. I upgraded for two reasons - ability to screen mirror through an HDMI cable and secondly, to be ready for 5G. 5G is really not very prevalent yet so I am not sure how much this matters. Thanks to the Smart Switch the transfer went smoothly. Remember, if you were hesitant as I was, the phone I received as renewed was a great buy.

Part 2 - After a week I want to say this is an excellent phone. The product quality exceeded my expectations. It was good as new.

title: Happy with My purchase
text:
I purchased the GS20 in Cloud pink as well as in gray. After recently going to the verizon wireless store and viewing the phones, I noticed that they all looked alike. There really is no major differences in the current galaxy phones on the market except the camera notch and quality of the camera. It really makes no sense to pay a grand for a cell phone when a newer version of the phone is released the following year and the features from GS20, GS21, to GS22 are not drastically different between all of the phones.

So, both of the phones I purchased appeared to be brand new, no scratches on the screen , phones were clean and even the backs of both phones were scratch free and intact. I chose to purchase the verizon compatible phone as opposed to an unlocked phone because I do not plan on changing wireless carriers anytime soon. As soon as I got the phone I was able to activate them with no problems and transferred the sim cards. I had service immediately and had no problems.

Both phones came with a charging cable and wall plug and sim slot opener. There was a protective film over the screen of the phone and the phones came in small sized box to fit the phone in. Overall, I am satisfied with my purchase; it will be years before I purchase a cell phone brand new. I have to see that the phone is indeed an actual upgrade.

I then connected to my home wifi and did a SW/FW update to latest Android and Samsung releases. Then used Smart Switch to transfer all of my data and apps from my old S7 to the "like new" S20. All within a couple of hours of receipt.

The phone condition is exceptional. There are no scratches or any other visible signs of use. Even the battery health is almost 95%.

One Year Update March 2022:
This phone continues to exceed my expectation. Has worked flawlessly since receipt and battery life still at 91% capacity (down 4% over one year). Continue to get both Android and Samsung SW/FW updates. Very happy with this purchase.

text:
I saw this advertising for the renewed/refurbished/second-handed objects on Amazon... they were supposed to be inspected and tested before being sold and so, so I thought "oh!... it is Amazon, this inspection may be good".
Well, I bought 2 of these cellphones. One of them, my sister was able to find the battery only lasted a couple of hours while still in the US, so she returned it almost immediately... Mine started to fail after the 2nd week (I was no longer in US, so I was not able to return it right there).
First, I was not able to plug it to charge it, only wireless charge available!!... then the battery only lasts a few hours... it never reached even 3G internet... the system gets slow sometimes, or frozen... anyway... it is something new every week!!

So that's concerning. Otherwise, super happy with this purchase. Also purchased the Asurion protection so the total was $650 and still saved $100 or so going this route.

text: I like everything about this phone.  The size is good, the pictures are great, easy to set up, and holds charge for a good length of time. Very happy with purchase.

title: Amazing phone for the price!
text: If I were to buy this phone from T-Mobile directly, I would get $1000 of debt added to my monthly bill that I'd have to pay off for the next 3 years, and it would have less memory and less internal storage.  Phenomenal deal.  I was worried that I'd get a phone I couldn't activate or that there would be some other catch, but this thing is better than I had hoped for.  No problems activating it at all.  It came with a screen protector already installed, and they did it perfectly!  The phone itself is immaculate.  I cannot tell that it's a refurbished model at all.  Not a scratch on it that I can find.  Picked up a 512GB micro SD card and an Otterbox case and still came in more than $300 under the T-Mobile price.  I'm pretty happy about how this turned out.

title: Huge let down....
text: I was upgrading from a galaxy s9+ and was really looking forward to having a galaxy s20.  I ordered 2 of these, both from the same seller. My husband's worked fine and he uses it daily.  Mine arrived dead (1% battery) and would not charge.  It kept saying the phones temperature was too low and it couldn't charge.  I tried multiple different chargers, tried wrapping it in a Towel to get it hot, tried wireless charging. Nothing worked.  I eventually contacted the seller and sent it back.  Had to contact the seller 3x before I got a response, but I finally did and they issued a refund about 2 days after I shipped the phone out to send back to them. I still needed a new phone, but I chose not to order my next one from this seller as I was skeptical.

title: Doesn't support SD memory cards
text:
Galaxy S20 supports SD memory cards, except for this Verizon sabotaged edition. In order physucal space inside the case to enable Verizon's version of 5g, Verizon removed SD support.

Verizon doesn't deliver 5g to my neighborhood, and even if it did it wouldn't be as good as the WiFi I have, so Verizon 5g is useless. I do need SD memory card support so I am returning this garbage Verizon edition.

I added 128gb micro SD card to mine for a total of 256gb and last but not least, it only cost me less than half of what a new iPhone costs.

I previously had an S6 for 5 years and only replaced it because the battery was completely shot. Then I got an A11 which is not the same quality phone. After just under 2 weeks I'm still finding new features every day. Phone was in excellent condition for "renewed". So scratches or dings. Set up was simple just moved the sim card over.

title: Not Unlocked
text: I purchased the "unlocked" version of this phone. The phone has 2 IMEI numbers that control how the phone connects to a network. I need this phone badly to care for my 99 year old mother - to talk to her doctors and provide her care! Only the first IMEI number is unlocked. The digital one - which I really needed as a last resort is LOCKED! I have to wait 3 days without a phone for sim card to arrive. This product listed wrong information. Either it is LOCKED or UNLOCKED. IN this case i is LOCKED for my needs and any customer who should need the option for connecting it.

text: I ordered the unlocked version of this phone, however they sent me a Verizon phone. Went to Verizon after about a day and a half with no response from the seller (they technically have 48 hours but I was needing a phone faster than that) Verizon said the software was flashed incorrectly. I had to have this fixed with them and ended up just switching to Verizon so I would not have to deal with the return. Then I realized the sim card tray was not the right color, so while trying to find a matching one I found out that the Verizon version of the S20 is the only phone that was made without a micro sd card slot, so I can now not use my memory card in my new phone. Very disappointed at the lack of response from the seller on the initial issue, and also disappointed that I was given the version that forced me to switch carriers because I was in a bind, and now I can't use my memory card.

title: Short and poorly placed antennas
text:
I didn't realize I would have such a problem getting cell service with this phone. I looked it up and the antennas on the inside are exactly where I hold my phone. I live in a rural area with small cell signal to begin with, so this is a minor annoyance. Because the phone is always searching for signal, it drains the battery like crazy. If you live in an area with good cell signal I don't think you'd have to deal with this issue.

Other than the antennas, I love the shape and size of this phone. It's perfect for smaller hands like mine and the camera is exceptionally good. The fingerprint sensor is great, but if you cover it with glass it doesn't really work well. I've decided that protecting the screen is more important than using my fingerprint, so I have tried out the facial recognition. The facial recognition works very well, I can open my phone with and without my glasses on without having to add an alternate appearance.

The original charger cable, block, headphones, SIM card removal pin, everything was still neatly packed and in its original place. Delivery was a day early, and the driver was kind enough to take the weather into consideration, which was a bonus in my books. Very pleased with my purchase.

title: Excellent condition must not mean what I thought it did.
text: I picked excellent condition because I had figured that while there would be some minor blemishes there wouldn't be anything too crazy. Apparently though having a corner all chewed up through the finish and pretty deep into the plastic is considered excellent. Beware, whoever is refurbishing these phones and rating them either isn't paying attention or has really low standards.

Drawbacks:  So much BLOATWARE installed it's taken weeks to sort it out.  Between Google, Samsung and Verizon, I can feel them fishing for more data all the time.  I suppose I'll wind up buying another similar phone and installing a less creepy OS like Lineage.

title: Not unlocked don't waist your money they are scamming
text:
Well I had high hopes for this phone. The phone is in good condition upon receipt. The problem is that it's locked into AT&T and not fully unlocked. The text messaging doesn't work, the one call I made was bad, and some of the other apps are wonky ontop of having AT&T all over the phone. I've messaged the seller to see how they will fix this. Because if they can't I will be returning for a full refund and spending my money elsewhere. Definitely not happy as I didn't need this extra problem. I will update if the seller responds to the message I sent last night.

Update: the seller was short, said they only advertised as unlocked (as compared to fully unlocked) as well as rude. The phone was returned and I got an S21 from a different seller for $50 more and it took 36 hours from purchase to doorstep. Always check to make sure the end number are U1 and then you know it's fully unlocked.

title: Phone was not UNLOCKED like advertised! Had to spend my own money (20.00)to send it back.
text: My husband bought me this phone for Christmas. We received the phone on time and it was in excellent shape as advertised but was not UNLOCKED as advertised. We were going to use it with AT&T but it wouldn't work with AT&T. We were told that the serial # was the problem. I really liked the phone so we attemped to use it with T-Mobile because that was the carrier we were using. It was disappointing and took several hours out of day to try and get it to work. I got on Amazon to start a return but had to be approved by the seller to be able to return it. Thank goodness he approved the return but I had to ship it back to him (Last of the loot)instead of Amazon. It cost me 20.00 to return it because I wanted someone to have to sign for it for extra protection to make hopefully we would get our money back for the phone. I printed the label and information out and it stated that it would take 2 to 3 days after they received it back to get our refund back. We waited about 2 weeks and didn't see the refund back to our account so I called Amazon to see what was going on. It only took a few hours to see the refund in our account which we were happy about. I just wonder if I didn't call about it if we would have ever heard anything from Amazon. We all live busy lives now a days and things slip our minds so if we rely on people to just do the right thing we would probably be out of luck.

title: "Refurbished" It looks brand new!!
text:
I was pretty hesitant on buying a refurbished phone, because I didn't know what actual condition it was going to be in. Amazon must have very high standards for these companies selling refurbished electronics. My phone came with a fast charging charger and cord, not sure if every seller does this but it was nice to see in the box. After I charged it I put in Verizon sim card from my old phone (Samsung A51), went through the process of setting up the new phone. Samsung makes it very easy to switch everything over from my old phone with the Smart Switch app. I'm absolutely loving my new phone, looks, feels and performs like a brand new phone. And so much faster than my 3 yo A51.
If I had to be but picky, the only thing that was slightly annoying was the 28 system updates I had to do to get the new phone up to date. Very minor gripe.
Also I'm not sure if this is with all Samsung S20's, but mine is able to run on Verizons 5g Ultra wide network, which is a huge plus I was not expecting

I did have to order a new sim card to get this phone on a 5G network (instead of transferring my 4G sim card from my old phone). Have been using it for a couple of months now with no issues. Better camera & battery life than the S8 I upgraded from. Overall menu options & most functions are the same. Lots of memory space which is good bc there is not a slot for a micro sd card. I transferred all data & photos from my old phone and there's still lots of memory to use. So glad I saved the money & went refurbished!

title: Still a great phone in 2023. With many more years of life
text:
The phone came in basic packaging, of course you don't get any original packaging because it's Amazon renewed. This is my 3rd renewed phone from Amazon and this was the best I've purchased so far. Was really impressed with the condition, like I said, it was basically brand new with a standard charger. I would encourage anyone to go the renewed option as this S20 FE 5G cost $220 compared to a NEW S20 for $600+. The screen is excellent, it has SD storage, physical and E-sim, Great camera + battery life, in screen finger print reader, it's really a great phone to have in 2023 for someone on a budget costing less that $250 renewed. title: Great alternative to paying top dollar for a new device
text:
I ordered the unlocked version and luckily got a T-Mobile version with dual sim for an external SD and 12GB RAM as I wanted since I heard the Verizon version has less RAM and a single SIM. To start the phone is in "near" perfect condition. The only small issues I could find were a tiny imperfection on the screen and some slight OLED burn in at the bottom of the screen where the buttons are. It looks like a small "P" with a circle next to it when viewing something on a white background but for the price I'm not too bothered. The phone also did not come with a screen protector but that was an easy fix. Everything I've tested works flawlessly including the battery life (which they guarantee at least 80% capacity).

Note for Verizon customers: I activated it on Verizon and swapped in my sim from my old S10 and come to find out 5G appears to work out of the box with no changes to my plan or anything so I'll take it. One annoyance with Verizon is they use their own visual voicemail app that comes pre-loaded on their locked phones. Unfortunately there's no way to install it on an unlocked phone so now I don't get notifications for voicemail and I have to call in to check messages. I even tried sideloading the APK but it doesn't work so not sure if it's possible to fix or not. Kind of annoying atm but maybe that will push me over the fence to switch to another carrier (like one that offers their voicemail app on the playstore - ie pretty much every other carrier).

Coming from an S10 that got a white screen of death after a small drop this phone is better in every way and can't be beat at the price. Even mid tier phones cost over 350-400 new and this phone is way superior being a top of the line phone when it launched and half the price. I'm glad I took the plunge and tried a renewed phone since I found my new way to upgrade my phone. No thanks to signing contracts and getting locked into a network. Buying a previous gen phone is the way to go for me for sure. I'm very happy with my purchase and just think you really got nothing to lose to try it out!

title: Phone failed after 5 months and did not meet ip68 waterproof standards
text:
This phone is advertised by Samsung as being ip68 water resistant - it is supposed to survive being submerged in 5 feet of water for 30 minutes. I accidentally dropped the phone in my hot tub (about 2 feet deep). It should have survived but it didn't.

After dropping it in the water, I immediately fished it out. After a few minutes, it stopped working and I could see water condensation on the inside of the front and rear camera lenses. I tried letting the phone dry out but the condensation remained inside. So I removed the back cover (accidentally cracking it in the process) and tried letting it dry out more. Unfortunately it never booted up again.

It appears that the rear cover was removed and re-glued as part of the refurbishment process, as I noticed two layers of adhesive inside. My guess is that the cover was not re-glued with the same quality as the factory glue joint, and that is how water got inside.

Pick your poison. That's life.

text:

Dec 22, 2022 10:47 AM
I got this S20 on Aug 11 and I just took it to U Break I Fix and he said that the charger stopped working due to a motherboard problem. He tried twice to change the charger plug twice and then tested it directly to the motherboard and it will not charge with the plug port. Before he did this he made sure it charged with a wireless charger that I do not have. He said when it will not charge with the plug and when he charged wirelessly the phone got hot charging it that way. So, he said it is going to not charge wirelessly pretty soon and then the phone is completely toast. I am now out over $300 for a phone that worked for 4 months. It is still in pristine shape also.
He said he cannot take it back.
Refurbished phones from this seller can be junk since the motherboard went out after they supposedly test it!!!

A phone with significant upgrades in speed, storage, battery life, but not too much bigger than my old S7

I'm very happy with this purchase. Only had the phone for about a week, but out-of-the-box this was exactly what I wanted. I've had great luck with Samsung in past so the S20 seemed like the natural upgrade for me. I avoided the S20+ and S20 Ultra due to the size and price. I was a little worried this phone wouldn't work on Verizon, but double checked Verizon's network specs against what this phone supports and all checked out. Out-of-the-box, I transferred my SIM card and everything worked perfectly - no need to visit a Verizon store. I was able to use Samsung's utilities to transfer over all of my old phone's contents without trouble. The phone arrived in AMAZING condition - no signs that it was previously used.

Couldn't be happier

title: Perfect For Me
text:
I was a bit hesitant to spend $250+ on a refurbished cell phone. However, after using my Samsung S20 5g for over a week now I can report it has exceeded all my expectations.
It was advertised as in excellent condition by thegadgetdeals and indeed it was. Quite honestly, this phone could have passed for a new one.

Being a "Boomer" I don't use most of the techy features like face recognition or fingerprint access. I can say that it did come truly unlocked and when I transferred my SIM card from Cricket into the phone it worked perfectly, including the phone functioning as a mobile hot spot from my mobile data.

So, all in all, I'm into a 5g, unlocked Samsung Galaxy at a fraction of the cost of a new one and couldn't be more pleased with the purchase.

However, when I powered it on it did not start up with the factory reset screen that prompts you to set up your google account, security, etc. Upon putting my Verizon sim card in and restarting it, numerous times, it would simply not connect to the network. I tried my boyfriend's Tmobile sim in it and it worked just fine. In the phone's settings, it said it was unlocked to support any sim. title: So far, a great refurbished phone
text:
I had to replace my s9+ after the speakers started going and I couldn't hear anyone on the phone anymore.
I was skeptical at first when looking at refurbished phones but my pockets aren't heavy so I took a chance and I can honestly say that (so far) I'm very happy with this purchase and it even appears that there is a screen protector already installed on the phone which is a nice surprise. The packaging was good, there's not a visible scratch in sight on the phone.
As far as this seller goes, they did a great job with this phone.
So far I've only found a few faults with this phone compared to my s9+.
1. Flashlight is not at bright on this phone which I assume will also be a disadvantage while using the flash for pictures.
2. There's no power saving mode on this phone? Like at all? The s9+ had at least 2, I don't think I ever used it without the powersave mode on so im not sure how much I'm going to like the battery life on this one. Note, there is some kind of wifi power saver? However, I almost never use wifi so I don't think that's gonna solve my issue.
3. The length vs width of the screen is almost awkward. I feel like it should be a little wider but that may just be me missing the size of my s9+ lol. I almost regret not trying the s20 FE but I'm going to try my best to give this phone an honest shot. So far the seller has a 10/10 but the phone itself is a 6/10, maybe a 7/10 if I can take a clear picture of the moon 🌙 🤭

UPDATE:
Okay, I've had the phone for a week or two now so I decided to come back and address my previous concerns.
The battery life on this phone is amazing even without a powersave option. I have no complaints about that at all.
The flashlight strength is still on the dim side for me but I'm getting used to it. I have not looked to see how it affects flash in pictures though.
I have gotten used to the different size of the screen and I think I will be just fine.
Overall I'm very satisfied with the phone. I would have to say it is a solid 8.5/10 compared to my S9+. The seller sits at a 10/10 as I have not found any defects with the phone yet!

title: FOOL'S ERRAND
text: Buy this phone if you want to go on a fool’s errand! This company has falsely advertised that the phone is unlocked. The phone is NOT UNLOCKED! While the physical phone I received was immaculate, it was locked to Sprint. I needed Verizon. I called Verizon. I called T-Mobile/Sprint. I called Amazon. I called the seller, ElectroWireless. After hours of trying to get this phone working, ElectroWireless told me I could do an exchange and they would “TRY to find me a Verizon-specific phone.” The “gotcha” is that the 90-day return window doesn’t restart. It keeps ticking from the date of the original purchase. NO THANKS. If you value your time and want to keep your sanity, don’t buy this phone unless you really want to play carrier-roulette!

All I had to do was go to the Sprint store and get a new SIM card (since my old one wasn't compatible- it was from my galaxy s8) and it was way easier than I expected. I love my new phone. It arrived a day before it said it would, and was in perfect condition 😁

title: Renwed - Looking Brand New
text:
Ordered:
- Samsung Galaxy S20 5G
- Cloud Blue
- 128 GB
- Fully Unlocked

That is exactly what I received in 3 days. For the price it is outstanding! Works great. Nice upgrade from my Galaxy S8. Works completely fine no issues transferring my SIM card over (AT&T) carrier.

Be sure to utilize the Smart Switch app on both phones when transferring data. Aside from very, very minor marks on 1 side of the phone, it is practically brand new for only $454.

title: Phone still registered under another owner/name
text: Received the phone but was still registered under another person. So couldn't transfer my line. Returned the item but it's one week  now and still haven't received a refund nor acknowledgement that the item was received. Learnt my lesson. This is the last time I am buying "renewed electronic" item, especially online!!!
